title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame during NFL Honors ceremony, becoming one of five inductees this year.
Vinatieri is NFL's all-time scoring leader with 2,673 points and holds record for most field goals made at 599.
He is the third kicker inducted into the Hall of Fame, joining Morten Andersen and Jan Stenerud.

title: Drake Maye loses MVP race to Matthew Stafford by razor-thin margin
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye finished second in NFL MVP voting, narrowly losing to Matthew Stafford by one first-place vote.
Matthew Stafford received 24 first-place votes for MVP, while Maye received 23; Stafford had 366 total points, Maye had 361.
Maye led the Patriots to a 14-3 record, with 4,394 passing yards, 31 touchdowns, and a 72.0% completion rate.

title: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel won the 2025 NFL Coach of the Year award, his second after winning in 2021 with the Titans.
The New England Patriots went 17-3 in the 2025 season and reached Super Bowl LX under Vrabel's leadership.
Vrabel, a former Patriots linebacker, implemented a new team culture that emphasized effort, accountability, and decision-making.

title: Unlike Tom Brady, Tedy Bruschi has a dog in the Patriots-Seahawks fight
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tedy Bruschi expressed strong support for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, unlike Tom Brady who remains neutral.
Bruschi cited his friendship with coach Mike Vrabel as a key reason for backing the Patriots.
The Patriots have allowed the fewest points and yards per game this postseason, prompting Bruschi's praise.

title: Pedestrian struck by police cruiser at UMass Lowell, officials say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A pedestrian was struck by a police cruiser near McGauvran Center at UMass Lowell's South Campus on Thursday evening.
The incident, termed 'tragic' by UMass, occurred around 6:30 p.m. at Wilder and Bachelder streets.
Lowell and Massachusetts State Police are investigating; the pedestrian's condition and university affiliation are unknown.

title: New Bedford police investigate after man goes missing, drowns in harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Vasquez, 51, was found dead in New Bedford Harbor on January 31, three days after he went missing.
Vasquez was last seen visiting a local adult establishment and worked on a ship at New Bedford Shipyard.
New Bedford and Massachusetts State Police are investigating the drowning; foul play has not been determined.

title: Cambridge brewery workers plan to unionize, file for election
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Lamplighter Brewing Co. employees in Cambridge have filed for a union election with United Food and Commercial Workers Local 1445.
The brewery has two taprooms in Cambridge, located at 284 Broadway and 110 North First St., opened in 2016 and 2022.
Bartenders Owen Murray and Ryan McFarland emphasize the need for unionizing to ensure employee perspectives are considered as the industry evolves.

title: Patriots OC Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year at NFL Honors in San Francisco.
Under McDaniels, Patriots improved from third-lowest to second-highest scoring offense in one season.
McDaniels on third stint with Patriots, previously left twice for head coaching roles.

title: Patriots, Seahawks both have defensive starters missing from practice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' linebacker Robert Spillane was limited in practice Thursday due to an ankle injury, while Harold Landry III didn't participate.
Seahawks' rookie safety Nick Emmanwori missed practice Thursday with an ankle injury but could still play in Super Bowl LX.
Landry's knee injury has reduced his effectiveness, while Emmanwori, a key defensive player, is being monitored closely.

title: NY man allegedly stole $325K in seafood from Worcester warehouse in 1 of several heists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Romoy Forbes, 31, is accused of stealing $325,000 worth of frozen snow crab from a Worcester warehouse.
Forbes allegedly participated in multiple heists, hacking emails to book shipments and sell stolen goods illicitly.
If convicted, Forbes faces up to 10 years for interstate transport of stolen goods and five years for conspiracy.
